node.title: Forbes residents told to prepare for flooding as deluge swells river to more than 10 metres
node.alt: A flooded area in a bush town
node.description: Rain keeps pouring and floods worsen for parts of New South Wales, threatening similar levels to the disastrous 2016 floods.
node.content:
["A major flood warning is in place for the Central West New South Wales\u00a0community of Forbes, threatening similar levels to the disastrous 2016 floods.\u00a0", "Several days of rain and spills from Wyngala Dam have seen a large amount of water flowing along the Lachlan River.", "Moderate flooding occurred on Saturday at Cowra, while moderate to major warnings were issued on the nearby Belubula River at Canowindra and Nanami.", "Forbes residents have been advised to prepare for flooding, with the Lachlan River expected to peak at 10.55 metres at Iron Bridge late Monday evening.", "Further rises to 10.65 metres are also possible on Tuesday, with major flooding, similar to the September 2016 flood event.", "Forbes Mayor\u00a0Phyllis Miller\u00a0said there would\u00a0be major flooding in the township.\u00a0", "", "
Major flooding isn't uncommon in Forbes, including in 2012\u00a0when the Lachlan River burst its banks.(Supplied: NSW Fire Service (2012))
", "SES crews began sandbagging low-lying properties on Saturday.\u00a0", "The river runs through part of the town so floods are not unusual for the area.\u00a0", "The last major flood in Forbes was in 2016 when\u00a0properties were inundated.\u00a0", "It experienced similar conditions in 2012 and back in the '90s.\u00a0", "Road closures are expected and anyone with plans to travel to the region is urged to delay their trip.\u00a0", "The Bureau of Meteorology is also forecasting major flooding at the nearby Cottons\u00a0Weir and Jemalong from tonight.", "Meanwhile, the Lachlan River at Nanami is expected to exceed the major flood level this morning, with it likely to reach around 12.30 metres later this evening.", "Heavy rain, which began on Thursday, has been exacerbated by larges spills of the now full Wyangala Dam, which sits at the top of the catchment.", "It comes on top of already full river systems following a wet winter and spring.\u00a0", "
Upstream Cowra teeters on edge
", "Business owners at Cowra on the edge of the Lachlan River have watched the water rise closer and closer to their shops.\u00a0", "Water swelled well past the river banks as it rose to more than 12.6 metres on Saturday.\u00a0", "", "
Paul Jones and son Sam hold grave concerns for their nearby motorcyple parts business if the Lachlan River at Cowra rises any further.\u00a0(ABC Central West: Xanthe Gregory\u00a0)
", "Paul Jones owns a motorcycle parts business which could be inundated if the levels rise just one more metre.", "\"We've been keeping an eye on it to make sure we don't have to go and sandbag and raise stuff off the floor,\" Mr Jones said.\u00a0", "The shop was flooded in the '90s and he hoped that would never happen again.\u00a0", "\"Hopefully it's done with and we can relax a bit,\" he said.\u00a0", "His son Sam enjoyed seeing a flood for the first time but has concerns for the damage it could do.\u00a0", "\"It's incredible how high it is but if it goes any higher it might not be incredible, it might be dangerous,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
Crops have become waterlogged in central west NSW as heavy rain caused flooding on the Lachlan\u00a0River.(ABC Central West: Joanna Woodburn)
", "
Farmers counting the cost
", "Cowra farmer Ed Fagan has lost a significant amount of his crops, including sunflowers, wheat and lucerne.\u00a0", "\"We've got a crop that we thought would do 10 tonne to the hectare that's now just a sea.\u00a0", "", "
Ed Fagan\u00a0has faced a tough year from worker shortages to floods on his mixed cropping property at Cowra.(ABC News: Hugh Hogan)
", "He said the timing of the flood was out of the ordinary.", "\"To have one in November is unusual and that's a problem because we've got all the winter crop that we've spent all\u00a0this money on to get it ready for harvest, a lot of that will be damaged,\" he said.\u00a0", "He has major concerns for those further down the river.\u00a0", "\"Down there the inundation will be for longer,\" he said.\u00a0"]
